Text: Rajon Rondo had his 26th career triple-double, paving the way for the Boston Celtics in a 100-89 victory over the Charlotte Bobcats Monday night at the TD Garden. The win was Boston's sixth consecutive victory overall, a season-high for the team. It was the third triple-double of the season for Rondo, who finished with 17 points, 10 rebounds and 12 assists in the standout performance for the Celtics (20-17). Paul Pierce added a game-high 19 points for the hosts, who have also now won four consecutive games at the TD Garden.
